textboxes.description: You’re exploring an abandoned warehouse, its shadowed corners filled with relics of the past: dusty shelves, shattered windows, and the faint hum of a long-forgotten power source. As you round a corner, an old arcade machine flickers to life. The screen pulses hypnotically, the name *Polybius* flashing in strange, shifting colors. You feel an unsettling draw, like the machine is pulling at something deep within you.

choices.text: Approach the machine and examine it closely.
Step back, sensing something off about it.
Look for a power source to turn it off.

textboxes.description: The machine hums louder as you draw closer. Its screen shows strange, pixelated shapes that seem to shift and change each time you look. Words flash briefly—“Play Me”—and you feel a strange urge to comply. It’s as though the machine itself is aware of you.

choices.text: Resist the urge and walk away.
Sit down and press the ‘Start’ button.

textboxes.description: You back away from the machine, feeling its eerie pull lessen. But just as you turn to leave, you notice something strange on the walls nearby: symbols and spirals, almost hypnotic in their design. They seem to pull you back toward the machine, whispering something indecipherable in your mind.

choices.text: Investigate the symbols on the walls.
Try to block out the pull and leave the room.

textboxes.description: You search the area, eventually finding a panel with frayed wires leading to a breaker box. With some tinkering, you think you can cut off the machine’s power, though it’s risky in its dilapidated state.

choices.text: Leave the machine on and examine it further.

textboxes.description: You fight the strange urge, stepping back from the machine. The lights on the screen flicker, flashing faster as if angered by your resistance. Suddenly, the machine lets out a loud, pulsing hum that fills the entire room.

choices.text: Turn and run out of the room.
Glance back at the machine, curiosity getting the better of you.

textboxes.description: You press ‘Start’ and instantly feel a rush of energy, as though something from the machine is entering your mind. Images, words, and memories not your own flash across your vision, and a cold, mechanical voice speaks: 'Welcome, Player.' The game begins, strange patterns emerging that almost feel alive.

choices.text: Try to focus and master the game’s patterns.
Pull your hand back, breaking contact with the machine.

textboxes.description: You study the symbols on the walls, realizing they’re a language of sorts, a coded warning left behind. They speak of minds lost to the machine, of players who were never seen again. You feel a growing sense of dread.

choices.text: Decipher the symbols further and try to disable the machine.
Decide it’s too dangerous and leave.

textboxes.description: You focus, matching the flashing symbols and navigating the labyrinthine patterns. Just as you feel the machine pulling deeper into your mind, you hit a wall in the game that seems impossible to pass, almost like it was designed that way.

choices.text: Push past, forcing your mind to the limit.
Accept defeat and end the game.

textboxes.description: You break through the game’s final barrier, and the machine lets out a high-pitched whine, powering down. You feel an intense release, like a weight has lifted from your mind. In the aftermath, you find a strange token inside the machine—a small, glowing artifact, pulsating with a faint light. Perhaps it holds a secret of its own.

You walk away from the machine, feeling the pull lessen as you put distance between yourself and the eerie screen. The haunting sound fades, but a strange sense of unfinished business remains. You may have avoided danger, but some questions linger, unanswered.

As you pull away, the machine’s lights flash erratically. Your mind reels, feeling fractured, as though something foreign has latched onto you. You stumble from the room, but a lingering thought remains, as if the machine’s influence still echoes within you. The memory of that screen haunts you, and you’re not sure if you’ll ever fully escape it.
